intro: Pouteria maingayi, commonly known as the Brazilian nut tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon Basin. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, oblong leaves and yellowish flowers. The tree produces large, woody fruits that contain a single, large seed, which is the source of the commercially valuable Brazil nut. Pouteria maingayi is also notable for its ability to thrive in humid, lowland environments with well-drained soils.
